title: Romans Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Romans with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 16 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the Book of Romans?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as the author in Romans 1:1.

questions.question: According to Romans 1:16, why is Paul not ashamed of the gospel of Christ?
options: It is the power of God unto salvation
It is a tradition of men
questions.correctAnswer: It is the power of God unto salvation
questions.explanation: Paul states the gospel is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes.

questions.question: What does Romans 1:17 say is revealed from faith to faith?
questions.explanation: The righteousness of God is revealed from faith to faith as written, 'The just shall live by faith.'

questions.question: According to Romans 3:23, all have sinned and come short of what?
questions.explanation: Paul teaches all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God.

questions.question: What is the gift of God according to Romans 6:23?
questions.explanation: Romans 6:23 contrasts death as the wages of sin with the gift of God, which is eternal life in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 5:8 states that God commended His love toward us while we were still sinners.
questions.explanation: God's love is shown by Christ dying for us while we were sinners.

questions.question: Who is described as being 'justified freely by his grace' in Romans 3:24?
questions.explanation: All are justified freely by God's grace through the redemption in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: According to Romans 4:3, what was counted to Abraham for righteousness?
questions.explanation: Abraham believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:' (Romans ___:1)
questions.explanation: Romans 5:1 speaks of peace with God through justification by faith.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 7:7 teaches that the law is sin.
questions.explanation: Paul states, 'Is the law sin? God forbid.' The law reveals sin but is not sin itself.

questions.question: In Romans 8:1, what is said to be true for those who are in Christ Jesus?
options: They must keep the law perfectly
questions.explanation: There is no condemnation to those in Christ Jesus who walk not after the flesh but after the Spirit.

questions.question: Who are the 'called, chosen, and faithful' mentioned in Romans 8:28-30?
options: Those predestined and justified by God
questions.correctAnswer: Those predestined and justified by God
questions.explanation: Paul explains God's work of predestination, calling, justification, and glorification of believers.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 9:16 says that salvation depends on the will of man.
questions.explanation: Salvation does not depend on man's will, but on God's mercy.

questions.question: What is the main teaching of Romans 10:9?
options: Belief and confession lead to salvation
The law is the way to righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Belief and confession lead to salvation
questions.explanation: Confessing with the mouth and believing in the heart that God raised Jesus leads to salvation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For the wages of sin is _______, but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.'
questions.explanation: Romans 6:23 contrasts death as wages of sin with the gift of eternal life.

questions.question: According to Romans 12:2, what should believers not be conformed to?
questions.explanation: Believers are urged not to be conformed to the world but be transformed by renewing their minds.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 13:1 teaches that all authority comes from God and must be obeyed.
questions.explanation: Paul instructs submission to governing authorities because they are ordained by God.

questions.question: Who does Paul commend for their labor in the Lord in Romans 16:12?
questions.explanation: Paul commends Tryphena and Tryphosa who have labored in the Lord.

questions.question: According to Romans 14:1, how should believers treat those who are weak in faith?
questions.explanation: Believers are encouraged to accept those weak in faith, without disputes.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the _______, both to the wise, and to the unwise.'
questions.explanation: Paul expresses his obligation to preach to all, Greeks and Barbarians.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 8:38-39 assures believers that nothing can separate them from the love of God in Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: Paul declares that neither death, life, angels, or any other thing can separate believers from God's love.

questions.question: What does Romans 11:36 declare about God?
options: He is the beginning and the end
All things are of Him, through Him, and to Him
He gave the law to Moses
questions.correctAnswer: All things are of Him, through Him, and to Him
questions.explanation: Paul praises God as the source and purpose of all things.

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 8:28, God works all things together for good to those who love Him and are called according to His purpose.
questions.explanation: God orchestrates all circumstances for good to His people.

questions.question: Who is described as a 'wretched man' who asks 'who shall deliver me from the body of this death?' in Romans 7:24?
questions.explanation: Paul uses this expression to describe the struggle with sin in the flesh.

questions.question: According to Romans 15:13, what fills believers with joy and peace?
questions.explanation: Faith in God leads to joy and peace by the power of the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am _______, sold under sin.'
questions.explanation: Paul confesses his own struggle with sin in Romans 7:14.

questions.question: What does Romans 3:28 teach about justification?
options: By works of the law only
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 6:4 teaches that we are buried with Christ by baptism into death.
questions.explanation: Paul explains baptism symbolizes burial and resurrection with Christ.

questions.question: According to Romans 5:12, how did sin enter into the world?
questions.explanation: Sin entered the world by one man, Adam, and death by sin.

questions.question: Who is called 'our Father' and 'the father of all them that believe' in Romans?
questions.explanation: Abraham is the father of all who believe, circumcised or not.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 13:10 says 'Love worketh no ill to his neighbour: therefore love is the fulfilling of the law.'
questions.explanation: Love fulfills the law by not harming others.

questions.question: According to Romans 2:13, who will be justified before God?
questions.explanation: It is not the hearers, but the doers of the law who will be justified.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be ______.'
questions.explanation: Romans 10:13 states that calling on the Lord's name brings salvation.

questions.question: Who does Paul greet as 'my beloved kinsman, and my fellow prisoner' in Romans 16:7?
questions.explanation: Paul mentions Andronicus and Junia as notable among the apostles and his kinsmen.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 8:9 states that if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he is not of Him.
questions.explanation: Possession of the Spirit of Christ is evidence of belonging to Him.

questions.question: According to Romans 11:33, what is described as unsearchable and past finding out?
questions.explanation: Paul marvels at the depth and wisdom of God's judgments and ways.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 14:23 teaches that everything not done from faith is sin.
questions.explanation: Paul instructs that whatever is not of faith is sin.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the law in Romans 7:12?
options: The law is holy, just, and good
questions.correctAnswer: The law is holy, just, and good
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes the goodness of the law despite sin using it.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For the promise, that he should be the heir of the world, was not to Abraham, or to his seed, through the _______, but through the righteousness of faith.'
questions.explanation: The promise to Abraham was through faith, not law.

questions.question: Who is commended as a servant of the church at Cenchrea in Romans 16:1?
questions.explanation: Phoebe is mentioned as a servant and helper of many.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 5:5 teaches that hope maketh not ashamed because God's love is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost.
questions.explanation: God's love in believers' hearts through the Holy Spirit sustains hope.

questions.question: According to Romans 12:1, what should believers present their bodies as?
options: Living sacrifices, holy, acceptable unto God
questions.correctAnswer: Living sacrifices, holy, acceptable unto God
questions.explanation: Paul urges believers to offer their bodies as living sacrifices.

questions.question: What is the relationship between sin and the law described in Romans 7:8?
options: Sin takes occasion by the commandment to work in us
Sin is the same as the law
Sin is abolished by the law
Sin does not exist where there is law
questions.correctAnswer: Sin takes occasion by the commandment to work in us
questions.explanation: Sin uses the commandment to produce all manner of concupiscence.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 8:11 promises that the Spirit of Him who raised Jesus from the dead will give life to mortal bodies.
questions.explanation: The Spirit who raised Christ will also quicken believers' mortal bodies.

questions.question: According to Romans 6:6, what has been crucified with Christ?
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that the old self was crucified with Christ to destroy sin.
